article.title: Non-Alcoholic Fatty Liver
article.p: When excess fat builds up in the liver of a person who doesnâ€™t drink much alcohol, its called non-alcoholic fatty liver (NAFL). Most often, NAFL occurs in people with high blood sugar, obesity, or high cholesterol. It is the most common chronic liver disease in the United States.
